        Does ui::PlatformEventSource::StopCurrentEventStream() achieve what you're looking for?  On X11, that will prevent further events from being dispatched (see "&& continue_stream_) [2]).  The only issue is that StopCurrentEventStream() is not implemented for WaylandEventSource [3], so you'll have to implement it if you want this to work with wayland.<span class="line"><!---->Does ui::PlatformEventSource::StopCurrentEventStream() achieve what you're looking for?  On X11, that will prevent further events from being dispatched (see "&amp;&amp; continue_stream_) [2]).  The only issue is that StopCurrentEventStream() is not implemented for WaylandEventSource [3], so you'll have to implement it if you want this to work with wayland.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ui/events/platform/platform_event_source.h;drc=a60b6a5add634cf45ee443f226a04e99b0f6af42;l=73<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ui/events/platform/platform_event_source.h;drc=a60b6a5add634cf45ee443f226a04e99b0f6af42;l=73"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ui/events/platform/platform_event_source.h;drc=a60b6a5add634cf45ee443f226a04e99b0f6af42;l=73<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ui/events/platform/x11/x11_event_source.cc;drc=6531e02635a3f00784aacad5c641cd16532657e5;l=156<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ui/events/platform/x11/x11_event_source.cc;drc=6531e02635a3f00784aacad5c641cd16532657e5;l=156"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ui/events/platform/x11/x11_event_source.cc;drc=6531e02635a3f00784aacad5c641cd16532657e5;l=156<!----></a><br>[3] <span class="line"><!---->[3] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ui/ozone/platform/wayland/host/wayland_event_source.h;drc=7dd58adeb690920a7474b4f7c5d71d23b15d4698;l=46<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ui/ozone/platform/wayland/host/wayland_event_source.h;drc=7dd58adeb690920a7474b4f7c5d71d23b15d4698;l=46"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ui/ozone/platform/wayland/host/wayland_event_source.h;drc=7dd58adeb690920a7474b4f7c5d71d23b15d4698;l=46<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, May 20, 2021, 12:47 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Security_Impact-Head -ReleaseBlock-Stable -M-92 -Target-92 Security_Impact-Stable M-90 Target-90
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Security_Impact-Head -ReleaseBlock-Stable -M-92 -Target-92 Security_Impact-Stable M-90 Target-90
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        As Ryan says, we don't ship security regressions of this severity, so that's why RBS is set. However, the user agent string in <span class="line"><!---->As Ryan says, we don't ship security regressions of this severity, so that's why RBS is set. However, the user agent string in <!----></span>#c0<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c0"><!---->#c0<!----></a> says the reporter originally reproduced this on M90 which means this is not a new regression. As such Security_Impact should be Stable, and this is not a regression, and I have cleared RBS.<span class="line"><!----> says the reporter originally reproduced this on M90 which means this is not a new regression. As such Security_Impact should be Stable, and this is not a regression, and I have cleared RBS.<!----></span><br><br>As to severity, <span class="line"><!---->As to severity, <!----></span>#c12<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c12"><!---->#c12<!----></a> is absolutely right. If there were not the UI interaction, this would be Critical and we'd be wanting to make a release to fix this within 24-48 hours. The UI interaction makes this less urgent. But the UI interaction is not wildly far-fetched... It feels to me quite realistic that an attacker could distribute this exploit code to a large number of Chrome users (e.g. via a compromised ad network or watering-hole website) then just wait for some of them to drag some tabs. They'd get lucky with one of the users in the end.<span class="line"><!----> is absolutely right. If there were not the UI interaction, this would be Critical and we'd be wanting to make a release to fix this within 24-48 hours. The UI interaction makes this less urgent. But the UI interaction is not wildly far-fetched... It feels to me quite realistic that an attacker could distribute this exploit code to a large number of Chrome users (e.g. via a compromised ad network or watering-hole website) then just wait for some of them to drag some tabs. They'd get lucky with one of the users in the end.<!----></span><br><br>As this is a browser process bug, the consequences are really bad. We don't have site isolation or sandboxes to save us. It's easy to imagine a variety of bad consequences: ransomware, bank account theft, impersonating enterprise users through cookie theft, etc. etc.<span class="line"><!---->As this is a browser process bug, the consequences are really bad. We don't have site isolation or sandboxes to save us. It's easy to imagine a variety of bad consequences: ransomware, bank account theft, impersonating enterprise users through cookie theft, etc. etc.<!----></span><br><br>So, in my opinion this remains a valid High severity bug and we'll ship the fix in the next bi-weekly release as soon as it's ready. As (I believe) it's Linux only, I think we will likely have to wait for a beta cycle to get some real-user testing, before merging to stable.<span class="line"><!---->So, in my opinion this remains a valid High severity bug and we'll ship the fix in the next bi-weekly release as soon as it's ready. As (I believe) it's Linux only, I think we will likely have to wait for a beta cycle to get some real-user testing, before merging to stable.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

This means things like RunLoop::Quit() don't<span class="line"><!---->of the MessagePump. This means things like RunLoop::Quit() don't<!----></span><br>work as expected, and can lead to unexpected state, resulting in<span class="line"><!---->work as expected, and can lead to unexpected state, resulting in<!----></span><br>crashes.<span class="line"><!---->crashes.<!----></span><br><br>On the Windows side, a single UI event is processed at a time.         OK. The problem is that adversaries monitor our git repositories and will have been working on weaponizing this since the first revision of your CL six days ago. Their glossy marketing brochures proudly advertise that they can weaponize our fixes in five business days, so that's about now :) That's why we need to push to merge high severity security fixes back.<span class="line"><!---->OK. The problem is that adversaries monitor our git repositories and will have been working on weaponizing this since the first revision of your CL six days ago. Their glossy marketing brochures proudly advertise that they can weaponize our fixes in five business days, so that's about now :) That's why we need to push to merge high severity security fixes back.<!----></span><br><br>For low-risk fixes we merge them back to the current stable branch after only 24-48 hours of Canary time. As this affects only Linux, though, I believe we don't have a Canary build. As you consider this high risk I'd like us to merge this to M92 only after it's been in Dev for a week, and then we can revisit whether we merge back to M91 at all (possibly not).<span class="line"><!---->For low-risk fixes we merge them back to the current stable branch after only 24-48 hours of Canary time. As this affects only Linux, though, I believe we don't have a Canary build. As you consider this high risk I'd like us to merge this to M92 only after it's been in Dev for a week, and then we can revisit whether we merge back to M91 at all (possibly not).<!----></span><br><br>(I don't think this is a prime candidate for our n-day adversaries, but still, we definitely wouldn't want to leave it until M93)<span class="line"><!---->(I don't think this is a prime candidate for our n-day adversaries, but still, we definitely wouldn't want to leave it until M93)<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        To trigger this crash requires a page to go fullscreen at just the right moment while the user is rapidly dragging the window between two windows. Please correct me if I'm wrong, but it seems like the chance of this happening is extremely low. Because of this, and because the fix is risky to merge, I don't think the merge is worth the risk.<span class="line"><!---->To trigger this crash requires a page to go fullscreen at just the right moment while the user is rapidly dragging the window between two windows.         by

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1207277#c41">Comment 41<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, May 25, 2021, 5:52 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

        I haven't tried to reproduce it. If you can persuade Ryan that this should be lower severity, that's OK with me, though as he says this has already been downgraded one notch due to the UI interaction.<span class="line"><!---->I haven't tried to reproduce it. If you can persuade Ryan that this should be lower severity, that's OK with me, though as he says this has already been downgraded one notch due to the UI interaction.<!----></span><br><br>FWIW I assume a skilled attacker will be able to detect when the tab is being dragged rapidly (whether or not we intentionally expose that) and will be able to go to full screen at just the right moment. So I don't see that as a huge impediment to a successful attack. On the other hand, the attacker has to get quite lucky for a user to drag the tab at all, _plus_ it's a visually-jarring thing for a page to go full screen and is unlikely to fly beneath the user's radar. So, I think realistically an attacker would have to attack at quite a lot of users to get lucky here. Attackers are in the fortunate position that they can repeat an attack many times on many users, but they'd probably choose a less intrusive bug.<span class="line"><!---->FWIW I assume a skilled attacker will be able to detect when the tab is being dragged rapidly (whether or not we intentionally expose that) and will be able to go to full screen at just the right moment. So I don't see that as a huge impediment to a successful attack. On the other hand, the attacker has to get quite lucky for a user to drag the tab at all, _plus_ it's a visually-jarring thing for a page to go full screen and is unlikely to fly beneath the user's radar. So, I think realistically an attacker would have to attack at quite a lot of users to get lucky here. Attackers are in the fortunate position that they can repeat an attack many times on many users, but they'd probably choose a less intrusive bug.<!----></span><br><br>But then again, that's why this is High not Critical... browser UaFs are really bad.<span class="line"><!---->But then again, that's why this is High not Critical... browser UaFs are really bad.<!----></span><br><br>Sorry for banging on about severity. Our merge guidelines are closely tied to severity, and it's quite exceptional for us not to merge a High bug into beta. (It's fairly unusual for us not to merge such fixes to stable). For medium bugs, we're much more flexible.<span class="line"><!---->Sorry for banging on about severity. Our merge guidelines are closely tied to severity, and it's quite exceptional for us not to merge a High bug into beta. (It's fairly unusual for us not to merge such fixes to stable). For medium bugs, we're much more flexible.<!----></span><br><br>Still, I don't want us to merge a risky fix even if we do decide this remains High. I think we'll know more in a few weeks after it's been through dev.<span class="line"><!---->Still, I don't want us to merge a risky fix even if we do decide this remains High. I think we'll know more in a few weeks after it's been through dev.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

        Waiting for the fix to bake SGTM.<span class="line"><!---->Waiting for the fix to bake SGTM.<!----></span><br><br>To trigger the use-after-free it's not enough to go fullscreen at the right time (which I think would be very tricky), the event queue has to have multiple pending move/drag events. This is why I think it would be quite hard to exploit this. I'm not saying impossible, rather extremely hard.<span class="line"><!---->To trigger the use-after-free it's not enough to go fullscreen at the right time (which I think would be very tricky), the event queue has to have multiple pending move/drag events. This is why I think it would be quite hard to exploit this. I'm not saying impossible, rather extremely hard.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        > To trigger the use-after-free it's not enough to go fullscreen at the right time (which I think would be very tricky), the event queue has to have multiple pending move/drag events.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; To trigger the use-after-free it's not enough to go fullscreen at the right time (which I think would be very tricky), the event queue has to have multiple pending move/drag events.<!----></span><br><br>Drive-by question.         It's actually not enough to move a window. I think the sequence is something like:<span class="line"><!---->It's actually not enough to move a window. I think the sequence is something like:<!----></span><br><br>1. in a window with multiple tabs start dragging one.<span class="line"><!---->1. in a window with multiple tabs start dragging one.<!----></span><br>2. drag the tab out of the window so that another window is created.<span class="line"><!---->2. drag the tab out of the window so that another window is created.<!----></span><br>3. as the newly created window is being dragged around, multiple events have to be queued by the OS (with the right coordaintes), the tab has to go fullscreen, and the mouse has to be in just the right position.<span class="line"><!---->3. as the newly created window is being dragged around, multiple events have to be queued by the OS (with the right coordaintes), the tab has to go fullscreen, and the mouse has to be in just the right position.<!----></span><br><br>By the window api, do you mean window.moveto? I believe that does nothing for tabbed-browser windows: <span class="line"><!---->By the window api, do you mean window.moveto? I believe that does nothing for tabbed-browser windows: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/chrome/browser/ui/browser.cc#1697<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/chrome/browser/ui/browser.cc#1697"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/chrome/browser/ui/browser.cc#1697<!----></a> .<span class="line"><!----> .<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;

          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;

            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }

            min-width: auto;

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;

  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;

    cursor: pointer;

 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }

 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });

  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }

    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }

            Close
          </button>
        </h2>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/90.0.4430.93 Safari/537.36<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/90.0.4430.93 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>1. download asan-linux-release-880812.zip and poc.html, unzip chrome.<span class="line"><!---->1. download asan-linux-release-880812.zip and poc.html, unzip chrome.<!----></span><br>2. start a server at floder of poc.html : python -m SimpleHTTPServer 8605<span class="line"><!---->2. start a server at floder of poc.html : python -m SimpleHTTPServer 8605<!----></span><br>3. ./asan-linux-release-880812/chrome <span class="line"><!---->3. ./asan-linux-release-880812/chrome <!----></span>http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html"><!---->http://127.0.0.1:8605/poc.html<!----></a> about:blank<span class="line"><!----> about:blank<!----></span><br>4. click the button, then drag and drop the first tab repeatedly<span class="line"><!---->4. click the button, then drag and drop the first tab repeatedly<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>This is similar to <span class="line"><!---->This is similar to <!----></span>Issue 1197436<span class="line"><!---->Issue 1197436<!----></span>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>but with different UAF positions, so I submit a new Issue. It seems that 1197436 didn't fix this problem completely. In function `BrowserView::ProcessFullscreen` at line 3335, `frame_->SetFullscreen(fullscreen);` is called, it will finally call `Drag` and could delete tab, but there are no weak_ptr check for that, so UAF occurs at line 3350.<span class="line"><!---->but with different UAF positions, so I submit a new Issue. It seems that 1197436 didn't fix this problem completely. In function `BrowserView::ProcessFullscreen` at line 3335, `frame_-&gt;SetFullscreen(fullscreen);` is called, it will finally call `Drag` and could delete tab, but there are no weak_ptr check for that, so UAF occurs at line 3350.<!----></span><br><br>``` chrome/browser/ui/views/frame/browser_view.cc<span class="line"><!---->```           Comment 3<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1207277#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      sky@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/3231893262" title="sky@chromium.org"><!---->sky@chromium.org<!----></a>
      sky@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->sky@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Mon, May 10, 2021, 11:12 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Mon, May 10, 2021, 11:12 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1207277#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, May 10, 2021, 11:12 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1207277#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, May 10, 2021, 11:12 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        As the submitter mentions, this is another case that will need a weakref check. The core issues is the nested message loop that tab dragging spawns. While it may be possible to eliminate it on linux, it is not possible on windows (because win32 internals run the nested message loop, not chrome).<span class="line"><!---->As the submitter mentions, this is another case that will need a weakref check. The core issues is the nested message loop that tab dragging spawns. While it may be possible to eliminate it on linux, it is not possible on windows (because win32 internals run the nested message loop, not chrome).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

        The priority is set based on the severity assessment. This would normally be Critical, due to where and how its crashing in the browser process, but this was downgraded to High because of the user interaction requirements.<span class="line"><!---->The priority is set based on the severity assessment. This would normally be Critical, due to where and how its crashing in the browser process, but this was downgraded to High because of the user interaction requirements.<!----></span><br><br>Note that even if downgraded to Medium, we'd still target this as P-1 by sheriffbot.<span class="line"><!---->Note that even if downgraded to Medium, we'd still target this as P-1 by sheriffbot.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hi sky, there is actually a CHECK fail in this poc, but it is a different crash to the UAF.(It seems that CHECK fail is not security bug). After click the button, you can drag the tab and don't release the mouse, when this tab become fullscreen, move the mouse to the origin position of the tab, CHECK failed occured, as shown in video.  This UAF crash is triggered in the middle of fullscreen, the tab is closed by drag and drop(`Drag` function), which is called by the function `frame_->SetFullscreen(fullscreen);` , after that, the use of object bind to the tab will trigger UAF.<span class="line"><!---->Hi sky, there is actually a CHECK fail in this poc, but it is a different crash to the UAF.(It seems that CHECK fail is not security bug). After click the button, you can drag the tab and don't release the mouse, when this tab become fullscreen, move the mouse to the origin position of the tab, CHECK failed occured, as shown in video.  This UAF crash is triggered in the middle of fullscreen, the tab is closed by drag and drop(`Drag` function), which is called by the function `frame_-&gt;SetFullscreen(fullscreen);` , after that, the use of object bind to the tab will trigger UAF.<!----></span><br>The drag and drop should occur at the same time as fullscreening, maybe you need to try many many times to repo it.<span class="line"><!---->The drag and drop should occur at the same time as fullscreening, maybe you need to try many many times to repo it.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        merc.ouc@gmail.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:merc.ouc@gmail.com"><!---->merc.ouc@gmail.com<!----></a>, thanks for the extra details.<span class="line"><!---->, thanks for the extra details.<!----></span><br><br>+thomasanderson and +gab<span class="line"><!---->+thomasanderson and +gab<!----></span><br><br>AFAICT the only way this could happen is if we dispatch multiple mouse events at a time, without checking if we should quit the message loop between the mouse events. On Windows we dispatch a single mouse event, and then check if the loop should be quit. On Linux, we may dispatch multiple mouse events before checking the quit status: <span class="line"><!---->AFAICT the only way this could happen is if we dispatch multiple mouse events at a time, without checking if we should quit the message loop between the mouse events. On Windows we dispatch a single mouse event, and then check if the loop should be quit. On Linux, we may dispatch multiple mouse events before checking the quit status: <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ui/events/platform/x11/x11_event_watcher_glib.cc;drc=6531e02635a3f00784aacad5c641cd16532657e5;l=46<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ui/events/platform/x11/x11_event_watcher_glib.cc;drc=6531e02635a3f00784aacad5c641cd16532657e5;l=46"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ui/events/platform/x11/x11_event_watcher_glib.cc;drc=6531e02635a3f00784aacad5c641cd16532657e5;l=46<!----></a> .<span class="line"><!----> .<!----></span><br><br>I could make TabDragController deal with this, or we could try to make linux behave like windows and dispatch a single mouse event before checking the exit status. Tom, is it possible to change the linux side? I favor making linux behave like windows as it is entirely possible this could bite other parts of the code base.<span class="line"><!---->I could make TabDragController deal with this, or we could try to make linux behave like windows and dispatch a single mouse event before checking the exit status. Tom, is it possible to change the linux side? I favor making linux behave like windows as it is entirely possible this could bite other parts of the code base.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

      gab@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->gab@chromium.org<!----></span>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1207277#c25">Comment 25<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, May 18, 2021, 12:04 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1207277#c25">Comment 25<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, May 18, 2021, 12:04 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        I also prefer making Linux match Windows as honoring quits ASAP is key to the message pump contract.<span class="line"><!---->I also prefer making Linux match Windows as honoring quits ASAP is key to the message pump contract.<!----></span><br><br>Note: on Windows, it's *possible* to have multiple "sent messages" run before honoring a quit because "sent messages" are dispatched by the OS from within ::PeekMessage(), but that's exception. Input messages come in as "posted messages" and are dispatched one by one (Chrome's pump regains control between each one).<span class="line"><!---->Note: on Windows, it's *possible* to have multiple "sent messages" run before honoring a quit because "sent messages" are dispatched by the OS from within ::PeekMessage(), but that's exception. Input messages come in as "posted messages" and are dispatched one by one (Chrome's pump regains control between each one).<!----></span><br>https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winuser/nf-winuser-peekmessagew<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winuser/nf-winuser-peekmessagew"><!---->https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/winuser/nf-winuser-peekmessagew<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        Does ui::PlatformEventSource::StopCurrentEventStream() achieve what you're looking for?  On X11, that will prevent further events from being dispatched (see "&& continue_stream_) [2]).  The only issue is that StopCurrentEventStream() is not implemented for WaylandEventSource [3], so you'll have to implement it if you want this to work with wayland.<span class="line"><!---->Does ui::PlatformEventSource::StopCurrentEventStream() achieve what you're looking for?  On X11, that will prevent further events from being dispatched (see "&amp;&amp; continue_stream_) [2]).  The only issue is that StopCurrentEventStream() is not implemented for WaylandEventSource [3], so you'll have to implement it if you want this to work with wayland.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ui/events/platform/platform_event_source.h;drc=a60b6a5add634cf45ee443f226a04e99b0f6af42;l=73<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ui/events/platform/platform_event_source.h;drc=a60b6a5add634cf45ee443f226a04e99b0f6af42;l=73"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ui/events/platform/platform_event_source.h;drc=a60b6a5add634cf45ee443f226a04e99b0f6af42;l=73<!----></a><br>[2] <span class="line"><!---->[2] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ui/events/platform/x11/x11_event_source.cc;drc=6531e02635a3f00784aacad5c641cd16532657e5;l=156<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ui/events/platform/x11/x11_event_source.cc;drc=6531e02635a3f00784aacad5c641cd16532657e5;l=156"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ui/events/platform/x11/x11_event_source.cc;drc=6531e02635a3f00784aacad5c641cd16532657e5;l=156<!----></a><br>[3] <span class="line"><!---->[3] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ui/ozone/platform/wayland/host/wayland_event_source.h;drc=7dd58adeb690920a7474b4f7c5d71d23b15d4698;l=46<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ui/ozone/platform/wayland/host/wayland_event_source.h;drc=7dd58adeb690920a7474b4f7c5d71d23b15d4698;l=46"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ui/ozone/platform/wayland/host/wayland_event_source.h;drc=7dd58adeb690920a7474b4f7c5d71d23b15d4698;l=46<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -Security_Impact-Head -ReleaseBlock-Stable -M-92 -Target-92 Security_Impact-Stable M-90 Target-90
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>

          <br>

      </div><br>
    
        
      
        As Ryan says, we don't ship security regressions of this severity, so that's why RBS is set. However, the user agent string in <span class="line"><!---->As Ryan says, we don't ship security regressions of this severity, so that's why RBS is set. However, the user agent string in <!----></span>#c0<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c0"><!---->#c0<!----></a> says the reporter originally reproduced this on M90 which means this is not a new regression. As such Security_Impact should be Stable, and this is not a regression, and I have cleared RBS.<span class="line"><!----> says the reporter originally reproduced this on M90 which means this is not a new regression. As such Security_Impact should be Stable, and this is not a regression, and I have cleared RBS.<!----></span><br><br>As to severity, <span class="line"><!---->As to severity, <!----></span>#c12<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c12"><!---->#c12<!----></a> is absolutely right. If there were not the UI interaction, this would be Critical and we'd be wanting to make a release to fix this within 24-48 hours. The UI interaction makes this less urgent. But the UI interaction is not wildly far-fetched... It feels to me quite realistic that an attacker could distribute this exploit code to a large number of Chrome users (e.g. via a compromised ad network or watering-hole website) then just wait for some of them to drag some tabs. They'd get lucky with one of the users in the end.<span class="line"><!----> is absolutely right. If there were not the UI interaction, this would be Critical and we'd be wanting to make a release to fix this within 24-48 hours. The UI interaction makes this less urgent. But the UI interaction is not wildly far-fetched... It feels to me quite realistic that an attacker could distribute this exploit code to a large number of Chrome users (e.g. via a compromised ad network or watering-hole website) then just wait for some of them to drag some tabs. They'd get lucky with one of the users in the end.<!----></span><br><br>As this is a browser process bug, the consequences are really bad. We don't have site isolation or sandboxes to save us. It's easy to imagine a variety of bad consequences: ransomware, bank account theft, impersonating enterprise users through cookie theft, etc. etc.<span class="line"><!---->As this is a browser process bug, the consequences are really bad. We don't have site isolation or sandboxes to save us. It's easy to imagine a variety of bad consequences: ransomware, bank account theft, impersonating enterprise users through cookie theft, etc. etc.<!----></span><br><br>So, in my opinion this remains a valid High severity bug and we'll ship the fix in the next bi-weekly release as soon as it's ready. As (I believe) it's Linux only, I think we will likely have to wait for a beta cycle to get some real-user testing, before merging to stable.<span class="line"><!---->So, in my opinion this remains a valid High severity bug and we'll ship the fix in the next bi-weekly release as soon as it's ready. As (I believe) it's Linux only, I think we will likely have to wait for a beta cycle to get some real-user testing, before merging to stable.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

        OK. The problem is that adversaries monitor our git repositories and will have been working on weaponizing this since the first revision of your CL six days ago. Their glossy marketing brochures proudly advertise that they can weaponize our fixes in five business days, so that's about now :) That's why we need to push to merge high severity security fixes back.<span class="line"><!---->OK. The problem is that adversaries monitor our git repositories and will have been working on weaponizing this since the first revision of your CL six days ago. Their glossy marketing brochures proudly advertise that they can weaponize our fixes in five business days, so that's about now :) That's why we need to push to merge high severity security fixes back.<!----></span><br><br>For low-risk fixes we merge them back to the current stable branch after only 24-48 hours of Canary time. As this affects only Linux, though, I believe we don't have a Canary build. As you consider this high risk I'd like us to merge this to M92 only after it's been in Dev for a week, and then we can revisit whether we merge back to M91 at all (possibly not).<span class="line"><!---->For low-risk fixes we merge them back to the current stable branch after only 24-48 hours of Canary time.         I haven't tried to reproduce it. If you can persuade Ryan that this should be lower severity, that's OK with me, though as he says this has already been downgraded one notch due to the UI interaction.<span class="line"><!---->I haven't tried to reproduce it. If you can persuade Ryan that this should be lower severity, that's OK with me, though as he says this has already been downgraded one notch due to the UI interaction.<!----></span><br><br>FWIW I assume a skilled attacker will be able to detect when the tab is being dragged rapidly (whether or not we intentionally expose that) and will be able to go to full screen at just the right moment. So I don't see that as a huge impediment to a successful attack. On the other hand, the attacker has to get quite lucky for a user to drag the tab at all, _plus_ it's a visually-jarring thing for a page to go full screen and is unlikely to fly beneath the user's radar. So, I think realistically an attacker would have to attack at quite a lot of users to get lucky here. Attackers are in the fortunate position that they can repeat an attack many times on many users, but they'd probably choose a less intrusive bug.<span class="line"><!---->FWIW I assume a skilled attacker will be able to detect when the tab is being dragged rapidly (whether or not we intentionally expose that) and will be able to go to full screen at just the right moment. So I don't see that as a huge impediment to a successful attack. On the other hand, the attacker has to get quite lucky for a user to drag the tab at all, _plus_ it's a visually-jarring thing for a page to go full screen and is unlikely to fly beneath the user's radar. So, I think realistically an attacker would have to attack at quite a lot of users to get lucky here. Attackers are in the fortunate position that they can repeat an attack many times on many users, but they'd probably choose a less intrusive bug.<!----></span><br><br>But then again, that's why this is High not Critical... browser UaFs are really bad.<span class="line"><!---->But then again, that's why this is High not Critical... browser UaFs are really bad.<!----></span><br><br>Sorry for banging on about severity. Our merge guidelines are closely tied to severity, and it's quite exceptional for us not to merge a High bug into beta. (It's fairly unusual for us not to merge such fixes to stable). For medium bugs, we're much more flexible.<span class="line"><!---->Sorry for banging on about severity. Our merge guidelines are closely tied to severity, and it's quite exceptional for us not to merge a High bug into beta. (It's fairly unusual for us not to merge such fixes to stable). For medium bugs, we're much more flexible.<!----></span><br><br>Still, I don't want us to merge a risky fix even if we do decide this remains High. I think we'll know more in a few weeks after it's been through dev.<span class="line"><!---->Still, I don't want us to merge a risky fix even if we do decide this remains High. I think we'll know more in a few weeks after it's been through dev.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        > To trigger the use-after-free it's not enough to go fullscreen at the right time (which I think would be very tricky), the event queue has to have multiple pending move/drag events.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; To trigger the use-after-free it's not enough to go fullscreen at the right time (which I think would be very tricky), the event queue has to have multiple pending move/drag events.<!----></span><br><br>Drive-by question. Do they _have_ to be move/drag events? If so, can a renderer cause those events through the window API?<span class="line"><!---->Drive-by question. Do they _have_ to be move/drag events? If so, can a renderer cause those events through the window API?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

        It's actually not enough to move a window. I think the sequence is something like:<span class="line"><!---->It's actually not enough to move a window. I think the sequence is something like:<!----></span><br><br>1. in a window with multiple tabs start dragging one.<span class="line"><!---->1. in a window with multiple tabs start dragging one.<!----></span><br>2. drag the tab out of the window so that another window is created.<span class="line"><!---->2. drag the tab out of the window so that another window is created.<!----></span><br>3. as the newly created window is being dragged around, multiple events have to be queued by the OS (with the right coordaintes), the tab has to go fullscreen, and the mouse has to be in just the right position.<span class="line"><!---->3. as the newly created window is being dragged around, multiple events have to be queued by the OS (with the right coordaintes), the tab has to go fullscreen, and the mouse has to be in just the right position.<!----></span><br><br>By the window api, do you mean window.moveto? I believe that does nothing for tabbed-browser windows: <span class="line"><!---->By the window api, do you mean window.moveto? I believe that does nothing for tabbed-browser windows: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/chrome/browser/ui/browser.cc#1697<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/chrome/browser/ui/browser.cc#1697"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/chrome/browser/ui/browser.cc#1697<!----></a> .<span class="line"><!----> .<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;

                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          
            
              <span></span>Anywhere<span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>

          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
